alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 3:53AM CDT until March 26 at 6:39PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County. .Heavy rainfall is expected over the Big Piney Basin tonight and Friday and will likely cause flooding at Fort Leonard Wood. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, the Pontoon Training Area at Ft. Wood Floods. At 9.0 feet, the Happy Hollow Picnic Area floods. At 16.0 feet, east Gate Road west of the river and east of the entrance gate to Fort Wood floods. High ground training area floods. At 19.0 feet, flood waters affect the water intake at the Ft. Wood Water Treatment Plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 3.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 18.2 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
